messages.message: @Anil We were discussing around the scheduler increments for HSBC’s go-live and wanted to verify with you on when we expect the change on the lower increments to be available?
it’s slated for the 22.08 major release. if HSBC is going to be on an earlier release we can backport the changes to another release if necessary
Hi Lenny, HSBC would be requiring this in 22.01 is that going to be feasible?
Also, what is the lowest value we can go to in terms of schedule time?
i think we should be able to make that work, will sync with @Anil on this today to confirm
it will accept any cronstring, so smallest increment is 1 minute

That's awesome and would be super helpful in our current use case as we're looking to lower the SLA for processing and the batches at 1 hour frequency are adding quite a lot of overhead.

Will look forward to an update from you on this @lenny

@Varun Rao — is it possible to push HSBC to upgrade to 22.08? we are trying to not backport features as much as possible. also, model service in 22.01 has a lot of scalability / performance issues. if they want to run a deep learning solution in production, 22.08 is a much better choice. it also has the latest scheduler app that is going to make maintaining this a lot easier.

@Kerry we are about a month from going into production with the use case. I don’t think it makes sense to get them into a 22.08 for a change related to scheduler. Unless a bigger issue crops up moving the production to a net new release is going to be a challenge

Cherry picking features back can also be pretty difficult and may introduce instability, not to mention it makes it harder for us to support a bespoke configuration for them. We generally want to treat these situations as exceptions or critical fixes rather than the norm
So here’s the argument @peter with our batch frequency being at 1 hour we are slower than their manual process by atleast 2x
when we take into consideration the end to end SLA
I’ll discuss with the team and get back on the feasibility of cherry picking this to 22.01.

Yeah that would be helpful. Any upgrade discussions will  add weeks to months of delays as upgrades have a lot of associated actions (image scans + dev->uat->prod) and we also have to factor in any new issues that get detected with net new releases before the use case is flagged for go-live
